title: Season 6 will kill some AP champions...
body:
Just lemme sum it up. 
1. We lose mastery 5% aa dmg from AA that will make last hitting harder
2. {{item:2004}} deleted - yea i know, manaregen increase and base mana, but those buffs are meaningless, comparing to 100 mana for 35 gold on some champions, who really needs mana to not lose their lane. 
3. 6  flat ability power and 7 ability power overall losed
4. no more 5% AP increase mastery 
Lots of item costs increase: 
5. {{item:3089}}  cost increase from 3500 to 3800 gold 
6. {{item:3285}}  cost increase from 3000 to 3200 gold 
7. {{item:3135}}  cost increase from 2500 to 2650 gold 
8. {{item:3157}} AP decreased from 100 to 80, armor from 50 to 45. 
9. {{item:3165}} cost increased from 2300 to 2550 gold 
10. {{item:3151}} cost increased from 3000 to 3200 gold 
11. {{item:3174}}  cost increased from 2700 to 2800 gold 
12. {{item:3001}}  cost increased from 2370 to 2450 gold 
13. {{item:3003}}  cost increased from 3000 to 3100 gold 
14. {{item:3060}} cost increased from 2750 to 2900 gold 
15. {{item:3152}} cost increased from 2300 to 2500 gold 
Also some of the mres items are getting a significant buff like: 
16. {{item:3102}} buffed, mres from 60 to 70, health from 450 to 500 
17. {{item:3026}} mres buffed from 50 to 60 
18. {{item:3156}} reworked so it gets extra mres and life steal 
19. {{item:3065}} buffed, Health increased from 400 to 500 and Magic resistance increased from 60 to 70. 


Just sum it up together, the total cost of a full build going to be higher by about 600 gold and more. This will cause a nice catastrophe that a lot of AP champions like {{champion:38}} {{champion:69}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:30}} {{champion:127}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:134}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:99}}{{champion:268}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:50}} {{champion:161}}  will be hit too hard, and some of them will not be playable anymore... 

Lets get an example of her {{champion:34}}. 
Perfectly balanced, with potential and nice to play champion. According to the http://champion.gg/champion/Anivia site, people are mostly building on her rod, archangel, rabadon, void staff and zhonya when full build. 
The amount of AP due to the 5% mastery and zhonya AP loss despite rod buff is going to be lower by about 30 - 35 AP, also the total build cost for the innocent bird is going to be 850 gold higher, facing enemies with better mres items and overbuffed ADC's. 

Im sad because it is a bad day for the game balance. I know, you are introducing the marksman rework and stuff like this, but you riot dont care about people LIKE ME who dont want to play them, and found myself better playing mages in your game. It is unfair, why people who are enjoying playing balanced champions going to have their enjoyment totally demolished for no fukin reason. 
Im sorry but i will give up playing this game in season 6, best regards your mages lover player.

and you know what? ADC don't have their items going up in price except BT and BRK(which hurts a lot of bruisers) 

what a coincidance they are the only classe who doesn't have their item having its cost increased

But most of their items are getting nerfed. Bortk on hit is getting a nerf, the "high single taregt damage" is phantom dancer with 40% attack speed, 30 crit chance, which is 10% less attack speed and 5% less crit chance. IE is getting 15 less ad, blood thirster is getting 5 ad less.

> [{quoted}](name=LongHair Fox,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QQ61j4KP,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-02T17:52:52.316+0000)
>
> But most of their items are getting nerfed. Bortk on hit is getting a nerf, the "high single taregt damage" is phantom dancer with 40% attack speed, 30 crit chance, which is 10% less attack speed and 5% less crit chance. IE is getting 15 less ad, blood thirster is getting 5 ad less.

And they get access to easy 40% CDR, 3% **max** mana regen on crit, overall increased crit chance across their build, +15% physical damage on near every non-Marksman in the game from Giant's Slayer and Lord Dominik's Regard, near-permanent Grievous Wounds and even better survivability vs burst in the form of Death's Dance and Phantom Dancer.

Not exactly what I'd call a nerf to their items.
The efficiency of their items is going down by about the same amount though.

They did say gold was also going up in minion kills I think.

I think Riot's idea is that item powerspikes will be weakened, but you'll get another item quicker so it sorta balances out.

Supposedly gold generation/min is going up and kill gold (or was it bounties?) is going up. Mages are also losing expanded mind and meditation in exchange for meditation with a cooldown. We can get 45% cdr at the cost of choosing between 5% cdr or ap/level or mpen (can't remember which and i don't have access to s@20 atm). Deathfire can add 3+ 36% ap scaling to any 4 second DoT or 6+ 20% burn over 3 seconds for instant damage. I don't know if brand's passive counts for that but if it does...
There's not really any good way to tell if it's anything beyond a power shift without playing some games as them. It might take a while to get used to the changes and hopefully if mages are struggling they'll receive the help they need.

Meditation is functionally identical with the new masteries, the only difference being that the new mastery gives the same MP5 as a burst every 5 seconds rather than as gradual regen every second.

It's just a change to make it feel impactful (restoring 15 mana in a chunk is much more noticeable than 3 mana per second, but it is the same amount over a 5 second window).

I feel... I feel like everyone is completely missing the part where... like... every AD item had its price increased except for Infinity Edge, which had its total AD reduced and its price reduced as well to compensate since it won't be nearly as good early on or even later on. LW was also changed to only affect bonus whereas Void still gets to affect total, plus most tanks max around 50ish MR while their armor gets up to 90-100 on top of the LW not affecting that 90-100, which is around 50% reduction by the way while 50 is only 33.3% reduction. Armor is also much easier to get and more common... 

I mean, mages are going to be fine. They get a free 20% ratio added to their combos with the new Deathfire keystone plus 2.5% boost in damage on CC'd targets, so if you stun them or even just slow them, you get a free 2.5% boost, plus early mana added on top of the corruption potion being incredibly amazing on these mages...

When it comes down to it more-so though. Gold generation was heavily increased. an extra 1 per 10s on top of more gold for shut downs and shut downs and if some one gets 2 kills, they can be shutdown for an additional 50g. They get to start with a snowball item that's nearly the equivalent of a Doran's Ring, plus it makes the potions give you more, including the refillable pots like the Corruption one.... lol.

Actually, {{champion:4}} ends up benefiting in a unique manner, since he has to ability to go either AD or AP.  In fact, that new Shiv item that increase the range of your next auto-attack will end up benefiting his gold-card-play immensely. :^)
They're also increasing gold production, so it might not be as bad as you expect gold-wise. I am nervous about the mana thing though.

This didn't... have to happen....
They could have just left tanks and mages alone and kept AD the same...
Galio was already unplayable.

Let's rework the adc's, nerf the ap items, buff MR items, and add a crappton of ad items while changing some as well. Even if you argue that "the ap items deserved a nerf" or some shit like that, the fact of the matter is that AP straight up WONT be played anymore. As an Ekko main I did really well as him. He struggles with mana early now and is just bad. He can't carry anymore because his build is incredibly expensive. 

Riot why the fuck would you increase the costs of ap items. Why? They're meant to be early and mid game beasts but now that their builds are on average 10% more expensive, they're late game. OH BUT WAIT WHY PICK A LATE AP CHAMP THAT DOES BADLY EARLY WHEN YOU CAN PICK A NEW AND IMPROVED ADC? Exactly. You don't. Ap won't be played and/or their winrates will drop an average of 4-5%. I guess we will find out how season 6 goes but as of right now, I'm pissed.
